name: Feed the Monster (Web Version)
description:
Feed the Monster is an interactive learning app that teaches children the fundamentals of reading. Collect monster eggs and feed them letters so they can grow into new friends! The game is based on years of research and experience in the science of literacy. It incorporates key skills for literacy, including Phonological Awareness, Letter Recognition, Phonics, Vocabulary, and Sight Word Reading so kids can develop a strong foundation for reading. 

Feed the Monster was funded by the Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs as part of the EduApp4Syria-competition. Curious Learning then localized Feed the Monster to 50+ languages, and have subsequently built a web version of the game to meet DPG criteria.

sdgs.relevance:
Early Literacy Learning App
Feed the Monster is an interactive learning app that teaches children the fundamentals of reading. Collect monster eggs and feed them letters so they can grow into new friends! The game is based on years of research and experience in the science of literacy. It incorporates key skills for literacy, including Phonological Awareness, Letter Recognition, Phonics, Vocabulary, and Sight Word Reading so kids can develop a strong foundation for reading. 

Most importantly, the efficacy and cost-effectiveness of the overall approach has been validated by a World Bank DIME study in Northern Nigeria. Targeting some of the most vulnerable learners, results reported 0.46-0.63 standard deviations increase in literacy/numeracy for 6-9 year olds, making it one of the few educational interventions that rank highly for learning impacts, cost-effectiveness, and scalability.

NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism: The Feed The Monster app does NOT require data collection to run, non-PII data collection is currently run through Firebase and is independent of the app. If one were to choose to collect non-PII through an alternative, like Couchbase, new data collection functions would need to be written and the data extracted from database storage.
